intro: Haplopappus insecticruris, commonly known as the narrow-pappus grasshopperweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in sandy or gravelly soils. It has small, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The species is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it an important component of its native ecosystem.
